item.name: Network CLOSE_WAIT connections
item.description: The remote end has shut down, waiting for the socket to close.

item.name: Network CLOSING connections
item.description: Both sockets are shut down but we still don't have all our data sent.

item.name: Network ESTABLISHED connections
item.description: The socket has an established connection.

item.name: Network FIN_WAIT2 connections
item.description: Connection is closed, and the socket is waiting for a shutdown from the remote end.

item.name: Network LAST_ACK connections
item.description: The remote end has shut down, and the socket is closed. Waiting for acknowledgement.

item.name: Network LISTEN connections
item.description: The socket is listening for incoming connections.

item.name: Network SYN_RECV connections
item.description: A connection request has been received from the network.

item.name: Network SYN_SENT connections
item.description: The socket is actively attempting to establish a connection.

item.name: Network TIME_WAIT connections
item.description: The socket is waiting after close to handle packets still in the network.

item.name: Network connections
item.description: Both sockets are shut down but we still donâ€™t have all our data sent.

item.name: Process with topmost CPU usage
item.key: system.run["TOP=\"${TOP:-5}\"; /bin/ps -eo 'pid ppid ruser rtprio ni args rss vsz pmem lstart time pcpu wchan' --sort=-pcpu | head -$((1+$TOP))","wait"]
item.description: Shows, in decreasing order the processes that are eating CPU. The number of process shown can be customized by setting the TOP parameter
